etymology.interpretation: The word 带走(帶走) (dàizǒu, "take away") combines 带(帶) (dài, "carry") and 走(走) (zǒu, "walk"; "go"). This suggests the idea of carrying something or someone with you as you leave or walk away.

examples.chinese: 妈妈把玩具带走了(媽媽把玩具帶走了)。
警察把嫌疑人带走了(警察把嫌疑人帶走了)。
examples.english: The police took away the suspect.

examples.chinese: 他把旧照片带走(他把舊照片帶走)，留下一段回忆(留下一段回憶)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ jiù zhàopiàn dàizǒu, liú xià yíduàn huíyì.
examples.english: He took away the old photographs, leaving behind a memory.
